output_list.criticism: The function lend() takes in a parameter _duration_in_days which is an unsigned integer. If the value of _duration_in_days is too large, it may cause an integer overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potentially loss of funds.

The function repayLoan() takes in a parameter _value which is an unsigned integer. If the value of _value is too large, it may cause an integer overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potentially loss of funds.

The function setlvlNfee() takes in a parameter newFee which is an unsigned integer. If the value of newFee is too large, it may cause an integer overflow. This can lead to incorrect results and potentially loss of funds.
The function setlvlNominalValue() has a typo in its name. The correct name should be setlvlNominalValue(). This typo can lead to confusion and potential security vulnerabilities.

The function setlvlNominalValue() is only accessible to the owner of the contract. However, it is not secure to allow only the owner to set the nominal value of the token. This can lead to potential security vulnerabilities and loss of funds.
